newsitem.title: BRAZIL: Brazil's real dips 0.01 pct in listless trade.
newsitem.headline: Brazil's real dips 0.01 pct in listless trade.

text.p: Brazil's real dipped 0.01 percent to close at 1.0831 per dollar in listless trade in the commercial foreign exchange market, dealers said.
In the late afternoon, the Central Bank bought dollars at 1.0830 per greenback to drain excess dollars from the market, dealers said.
"Nothing happened other than (the afternoon) buy tender," one trader said.
At 1635 local/1935 GMT, preliminary figures for commercial and financial forex contracts showed a $185 million surplus.
In the interbank floating rate market, the real closed at 1.0886 per dollar, 0.01 percent down.
In the parallel market, the real rose 0.61 percent to end at 1.140 per greenback due to an increase in the supply pf dollars, traders said.
